column3: Single Leg Stance: Stand behind a sturdy chair and hold onto it for support. Lift one foot off the ground and balance on the other foot for 10-15 seconds. Repeat on the other side
column4: Heel-to-Toe Walk: Take small steps forward placing the heel of one foot directly in front of the toes of the other foot. Walk in a straight line for a few steps
column5: then turn around and walk back
column6: Tandem Stance: Stand with one foot directly in front of the other - heel to toe - like walking on a tightrope. Hold this position for 10-15 seconds then switch sides
column7: Clock Reach: Stand on one leg and extend the opposite leg behind you. Reach both arms forward then slowly reach one arm to the side then overhead and finally to the ground while maintaining balance. Return to the starting position and switch legs
column8: Seated Forward Bend: Sit on the edge of a chair with your feet flat on the floor. Hinge at the hips and lean forward reaching your hands towards your feet. Hold for 15-30 seconds then slowly return to an upright position
column9: Neck Stretch: Sit tall in a chair and gently tilt your head to one side bringing your ear towards your shoulder. Hold for 15-30 seconds then switch sides
column10: Seated Spinal Twist: Sit on a chair with your feet flat on the floor. Twist your torso to one side placing one hand on the opposite knee and the other hand on the back of the chair for support. Hold for 15-30 seconds then switch sides
column11: Hip Flexor Stretch: Stand behind a chair and hold onto it for support. Take a step back with one foot and bend your front knee lowering into a lunge position. Keep your back knee straight and gently push your hips forward until you feel a stretch in the front of your hip. Hold for 15-30 seconds then switch sides
